Mortmain.definition: the possession of real property in perpetuity by a corporate body
Mortmain.origin: [Anglo-French, from Old French mortemain , from morte (feminine of mort dead, from Latin mortuus ) + main hand, from Latin manus ]

1.definition: the possession of real property in perpetuity by a corporate body (as a church)the condition of property in such possession

2.definition: the controlling influence of the past not used technically
